questions.text: Who broke into Kara's apartment in the opening scene?
questions.explanation:
Non.

	He demanded Kara's help to lead the prayer for the dead of Astrid.  Astrid had been killed in the prior episode. It was Kryptonian custom for a surviving female to lead the prayer.

questions.text: How long is the mourning period for a dead Kryptonian?
questions.explanation:
2 weeks.

	They give daily prayers and offerings to the god Ra. Non agreed to observe the mourning period and then vowed to kill Kara.

questions.text: What did Maxwell receive as a gift for assisting the DEO?
questions.explanation:
A Netflix account.

	Maxwell was still in prison from a few episodes earlier. Kara suggested that he watch "Call the Midwife".  DEO stands for Department of Extra-Normal Operations.

questions.text: What did Cat Grant do to upset Kara?
options: Refused to let Kara go on vacation
questions.explanation:
Hired a second assistant.

	She then named the new assistant "Assistant #1" and delegated Kara as #2. Kara was delegated to answering phones while the new woman did everything else.

questions.text: What did the alien bounty hunter call himself?
questions.explanation:
The Master Jailer.

	He was in the process of executing a criminal that had escaped from Fort Roz when he first revealed his name. His method of execution is beheading. The criminal he was dealing with at that time was his fifth victim.

questions.text: Who discovered the existence of the DEO?
questions.explanation:
Lucy.

	It was supposedly a secret group within the military. She told James about it and he accidentally revealed that he had known about it for a long time. Lucy then got upset that James was close with Supergirl, assuming that is how he knew about it.

questions.text: Cat Grant told James about an actor she'd covered in the past. What was the name of that actor?
questions.explanation:
It wasn't revealed.

	Cat had uncovered a truth about the actor that he was a wife beater, but she caved in and wrote a puff piece about him being a nice guy. Three months later the actor killed his wife with a shotgun.  She told James the story to explain to him why journalists have to take their stories personally.

questions.text: Which of Supergirl's loved ones got shot?
questions.explanation:
Alex.

	Supergirl and Alex were trying to arrest the bounty hunter/murderer. They had narrowed it down to one of the detectives they had interacted with earlier. They chose the wrong one and Alex was shot by the detective's partner during the attempted arrest. She survived.

questions.text: Who was kidnapped by the bounty hunter?
questions.explanation:
Supergirl.

	She was taken when she stopped to check on Alex. The bounty hunter locked her in a small cage that had a red sun mimicking light hanging above it. That light neutralized her powers.

False.

	She bested him after Alex came through and helped free her. She had the opportunity to snap his neck and decided to let him live. After the fight she returned to the DEO and freed Maxwell Lord because it was the "right thing to do".
